unittitle.value: Ivan Greenberg FBI Research Files on Labor and Radicalism

abstract.value: Ivan Greenberg is an historian and author.This collecion contains FBI files obtained under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) by Greenberg on the Socialist Scholars Conference, the Socialist Workers Party, Dissent magazine, the Institute for Policy Studies, and Gus Hall.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Ivan Greenberg FBI Research Files on Labor and Radicalism; TAM 573; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Ivan Greenberg in 2011. The accession number associated with this gift is 2011.025.
Ivan Greenberg is an historian and the author of <emph render="italic">The Dangers of Dissent: The FBI and Civil Liberties Since 1965</emph> (Lexington Books, 2010).

This collecion contains FBI files obtained under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) by Ivan Greenberg on the Socialist Scholars Conference, the Socialist Workers Party, Dissent magazine, the Institute for Policy Studies, and Gus Hall.

subject.value: Civil rights and socialism |z United States.
